screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "System" settings menu on an Android device. It includes options for "Languages & input" (with Gboard as the current keyboard), "Gestures," "Date & time" (set to Pacific Daylight Time), "Backup" (currently off), and an "Advanced" section with "Reset options" and "System update." The interface allows users to configure these settings for their device.
action_think: The user wants to change the appearance of the keyboard. Since the current screen shows the 'System' settings menu with 'Languages & input' as an option, the next logical step is to tap on 'Languages & input' to proceed to the keyboard settings, where the appearance can be modified.
action_plan: Tap on 'Languages & input' to access keyboard settings.
action_desc: Tap on 'Languages & input' to access keyboard settings.
action_result:
By clicking on the "Languages & input" option, I have navigated to the settings where you can adjust the input methods for the device. The current screen now shows the "Keyboards" section, which includes options like "Virtual keyboard" (Gboard and Google voice typing) and "Physical keyboard" settings. 

This action has made progress toward completing your request because, in this menu, you can further adjust the appearance and settings of the virtual keyboard (Gboard), which is related to changing the keyboard's look.
prev_action_result:
By clicking on the "System" option in the last action, the settings menu for system-related features has been opened. Now, in the current screenshot, you can see options related to languages, gestures, date & time, backup, and advanced settings, including "Languages & input." This is an important step toward fulfilling the user request, as changing the keyboard's appearance usually involves going into the "Languages & input" settings. 

This action has made progress toward completing the user request because it has opened the section of the settings where you can manage input methods, which is where the option to change the keyboard look will likely be found. The next step would be selecting the "Languages & input" option to modify the keyboard's settings.
